009
010package imagingbook.pub.edgepreservingfilters;
011
012import static imagingbook.pub.edgepreservingfilters.TschumperleDericheF.kernelDx;
013import static imagingbook.pub.edgepreservingfilters.TschumperleDericheF.kernelDy;
014
015import imagingbook.lib.filter.GenericFilter;
016import imagingbook.lib.filter.linear.GaussianFilterSeparable;
017import imagingbook.lib.filter.linear.LinearFilter;
018import imagingbook.lib.image.data.PixelPack;
019import imagingbook.lib.image.data.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
020import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
021import imagingbook.lib.math.eigen.Eigensolver2x2;
022import imagingbook.pub.edgepreservingfilters.TschumperleDericheF.Parameters;
023
024/**
025 * This class implements the Anisotropic Diffusion filter proposed by David Tschumperle 
026 * in D. Tschumperle and R. Deriche, "Diffusion PDEs on vector-valued images", 
027 * IEEE Signal Processing Magazine, vol. 19, no. 5, pp. 16-25 (Sep. 2002). It is based 
028 * on an earlier C++ (CImg) implementation (pde_TschumperleDeriche2d.cpp) by the original
029 * author, made available under the CeCILL v2.0 license 
030 * (http://www.cecill.info/licences/Licence_CeCILL_V2-en.html).
031 * 
032 * This class is based on the ImageJ API and intended to be used in ImageJ plugins.
033 * How to use: consult the source code of the related ImageJ plugins for examples.
034 * 
035 * @version 2021/01/06 (complete rewrite from scratch)
036 */
037
038public class TschumperleDericheFilter extends GenericFilter {
039
040        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
041        
042        private final Parameters params;
043        private int M;                          // image width
044        private int N;                          // image height
045        private int K;                          // number of color channels (any, but typ. 1 or 3)
046        
047        // temporary data
048        private PixelPack Dx, Dy;
049        private PixelPack G;            // structure matrix as (u,v) with 3 elements
050        
051        private GenericFilter filterDx, filterDy;
052        private GenericFilter gradientBlurFilter;
053        private GenericFilter structureBlurFilter;
054        
055        private int T;          // number of iterations
056        private float alpha;
057        private double a1, a2;
058        private PixelPack source, target;
059        
060        
061        public TschumperleDericheFilter() {
062                this(new Parameters());
063        }
064        
065        public TschumperleDericheFilter(Parameters params) {
066                this.params = params;
067        }
068        
069        @Override
070        protected void initFilter(PixelPack source, PixelPack target) { // called by {@link GenericFilter}
071                this.source = source;
072                this.target = target;
073                
074                this.M = source.getWidth(); 
075                this.N = source.getHeight(); 
076                this.K = source.getDepth();
077                
078                this.T = params.iterations;
079                this.alpha = params.initialAlpha;
080                this.a1 = params.a1;
081                this.a2 = params.a2;
082                
083                this.Dx = new PixelPack(source, false); // container for X/Y-derivatives
084                this.Dy = new PixelPack(source, false);
085                
086                this.filterDx = new LinearFilter(kernelDx);
087                this.filterDy = new LinearFilter(kernelDy);
088                
089                this.gradientBlurFilter = new GaussianFilterSeparable(params.sigmaG);   
090                this.structureBlurFilter = new GaussianFilterSeparable(params.sigmaS);
091                
092                this.G = new PixelPack(M, N, 3, null);  // structure matrix as (u,v) with 3 elements    
093        }
094        
095        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
096        
097        @Override
098        protected void runPass(PixelPack source, PixelPack target) {
099                makeGradients();                                                        // Step 1
100                makeStructureMatrix();                                          // Step 2
101                float maxVelocity = updateImage();      // Step 3
102                alpha = (float) params.dt / maxVelocity;        // Step 4: re-adjust alpha
103        }
104        
105        // ------------------------------------------------------------
106        
107        private void makeGradients() {
108                // x-gradients:
109                source.copyTo(Dx);
110                filterDx.applyTo(Dx);
111                gradientBlurFilter.applyTo(Dx);
112                // y-gradients:
113                source.copyTo(Dy);
114                filterDy.applyTo(Dy);
115                gradientBlurFilter.applyTo(Dy);
116        }
117        
118        private void makeStructureMatrix() {    // make G
119                for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
120                        for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
121                                final float[] dx = Dx.getVec(u, v);
122                                final float[] dy = Dy.getVec(u, v);
123                                float g0 = 0; float g1 = 0; float g2 = 0;
124                                for (int k = 0; k < K; k++) {
125                                        final float fx = dx[k];
126                                        final float fy = dy[k];
127                                        g0 += fx * fx;
128                                        g1 += fx * fy;
129                                        g2 += fy * fy;
130                                }
131                                G.setVec(u, v, g0, g1, g2);
132                        }
133                }
134                structureBlurFilter.applyTo(G);
135        }
136
137        private float updateImage() {
138                float betaMax = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;        // maximum velocity
139                for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
140                        for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
141                                // calculate the local geometry matrix A(u,v), which has only 3 distinct elements
142                                float[] A = getGeometryMatrix(u, v);
143                                float[] p = source.getVec(u, v);
144                                for (int k = 0; k < K; k++) {
145                                        float[] H = getHessianMatrix(k, u, v); // local Hessian for channel k at pos u,v (3 elements)
146                                        float beta = A[0] * H[0] + 2 * A[1] * H[1] + A[2] * H[2]; // = trace (A*H)
147                                        betaMax = Math.max(betaMax, Math.abs(beta)); // find max absolute velocity for time-step adaptation
148                                        // update the image (result goes to target)
149                                        p[k] = p[k] + alpha * beta;     // we use alpha from the previous pass!
150                                }
151                                target.setVec(u, v, p);
152                        }
153                }
154                return betaMax;
155        }
156        
157        private float[] getGeometryMatrix(int u, int v) {
158                float[] Guv = G.getVec(u, v); // 3 elements of local geometry matrix (2x2)
159                
160                // calculate the 2 eigenvalues lambda1, lambda2 and the greater eigenvector e1
161                Eigensolver2x2 solver = new Eigensolver2x2(Guv[0], Guv[1], Guv[1], Guv[2]);
162                if (!solver.isReal()) {
163                        throw new RuntimeException("undefined eigenvalues in " + 
164                                        this.getClass().getSimpleName());
165                }
166                double lambda1 = solver.getEigenvalue(0);
167                double lambda2 = solver.getEigenvalue(1);
168                double[] evec1 = solver.getEigenvector(0);
169                normalize(evec1);       
170                double arg = 1.0 + lambda1 + lambda2;   // 1 + lambda_1 + lambda_2
171                float c1 = (float) Math.pow(arg, -a1);
172                float c2 = (float) Math.pow(arg, -a2);
173                
174                // mount geometry matrix A:
175                float x1 = (float) evec1[0];
176                float y1 = (float) evec1[1];
177                float xx1 = x1 * x1;
178                float xy1 = x1 * y1;
179                float yy1 = y1 * y1;
180                
181                float A0 = c1 * yy1 + c2 * xx1;
182                float A1 = (c2 - c1)* xy1;
183                float A2 = c1 * xx1 + c2 * yy1;
184                return new float[] {A0, A1, A2};
185        }
186
187        
188        // Calculate the Hessian matrix Hk for channel k at position (u,v)
189        private float[] getHessianMatrix(int k, int u, int v) {
190                float[] Hk = new float[3];
191                PixelSlice Ik = source.getSlice(k);
192                float icc = Ik.getVal(u, v);
193                Hk[0] = Ik.getVal(u-1,v) + Ik.getVal(u+1,v) - 2 * icc;                                                          // = H_xx(u,v)
194                Hk[1] = 0.25f * (Ik.getVal(u-1,v-1) + Ik.getVal(u+1,v+1) - Ik.getVal(u-1,v+1) - Ik.getVal(u+1,v-1));    // = H_xy(u,v)
195                Hk[2] = Ik.getVal(u,v+1) + Ik.getVal(u,v-1) - 2 * icc;                                                          // = H_yy(u,v)
196                return Hk;
197        }
198        
199        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
200        
201        private void normalize(double[] vec) {
202                double norm = Matrix.normL2(vec);
203                if (norm > 1E-6) {
204                        for (int i = 0; i < vec.length; i++) {
205                                vec[i] = vec[i] / norm;
206                        }
207                }
208        }
209        
210        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
211        
212        @Override
213        protected final int passesRequired() {
214                return T;       // this filter needs T passes
215        }
216        
217        @Override
218        // cleanup temporary data (probably unnecessary)
219        protected void closeFilter() {
220                this.Dx = null;
221                this.Dy = null;
222                this.G = null;
223        }
224
225}
226
